entry.title: MiraclePtr: Remove unused buildflag
entry.content:
`BUILDFLAG(FORCIBLY_ENABLE_BACKUP_REF_PTR_IN_ALL_PROCESSES)` was

introduced for early-stage experimentation in bringing MiraclePtr to the

renderer process. Current experimentation freely enables MiraclePtr in

the renderer process, and we're merely fine-tuning the set of pointers

rewritten to use `raw_ptr`. There's no further need for this particular

buildflag.



Bug: 40064499

Change-Id: I58278d924f5fb62f49a368a81d5ac0dabf10be92

entry.title: More fixes for code assuming that libc++ iterators are raw pointers
entry.content:
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/pull/74482 changes the iterator

type for std::string_view and std::array so that they're no longer raw

pointers. This CL fixes builds for ChromeOS, MacOS, Android, and iOS.



This CL does *not* fix Windows and Fuchsia - Windows is fixed in

https://crrev.com/c/5362998, and Fuchsia is being fixed upstream.



These changes were tested in a sample libc++ roll in

https://crrev.com/c/5362421.



AX-Relnotes: n/a

Bug: 328308661

entry.title: [accessibility] Propagate mode changes to frames in the BF cache
entry.content:
A WebContentsImpl must notify all RenderFrameHostImpls for which it is

the RenderFrameHostDelegate when there is a change in the accessibility

mode flags; including frame hosts that are in the back-forward cache.

Previously, frame hosts in the BF cache were not notified, which could

lead to them receiving accessibility updates and events from a renderer

after accessibility had been turned off for the owning WebContents.



Bug: 326751711

Change-Id: I164b4ff8285a2c0d94db9a3caac53db73cd51456

Fixed: 326262509

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5368451

Commit-Queue: Rakina Zata Amni

Auto-Submit: Greg Thompson

Reviewed-by: Rakina Zata Amni

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1272548}

entry.title: Reland "Add indicator when notifications permission is blocked by the OS."
entry.content:
This is a reland of commit e77dbc56f726c5929bf14cb17c0dcb6bafbf2007



The only difference being a missing null-check for the WebContents in

LocationBarView.



Original change's description:

> Add indicator when notifications permission is blocked by the OS.

>

> When notifications aren't working for a PWA because permission

> was blocked at the OS level (but granted at the chrome level), this

> CL causes an indicator icon to be shown (in omnibox or titlebar

> depending on if the PWA is open in a browser tab or PWA window).

> This icon has a bubble guiding the user to System Settings to fix

> this situation. Additionally this bubble automatically pops up when

> chrome auto-denies notification permission because the system level

> permission was previously denied.

>

> Currently only notification usage in documents causes this icon/bubble

> to show. If all notification usage is done in worker contexts the

> icon will not be shown (as there might not even be any document to

> show the icon in in that case).

>

> Bug: 40616749

> Change-Id: I0598fe34cb723515d77455fcf64eca95cb823a1e

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5319471

> Reviewed-by: Dibyajyoti Pal

> Reviewed-by: Andy Paicu

> Reviewed-by: Peter Kasting

> Reviewed-by: Martin Šrámek

> Commit-Queue: Marijn Kruisselbrink

> Reviewed-by: Jeffrey Cohen

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1271898}

entry.title: Allow child processes to inherit logging file handle on Windows
entry.content:
Child processes on Windows cannot always open their log file

(for instance if they cannot determine the user-data-dir) making

configuration of logging complicated. Child processes also need

a sandbox exception to open their log files.



This CL replaces logging related flags to pass a handle to children

in cases where a file would have been passed, allowing a later CL

to remove the sandbox rule allowing direct access to the log file.



If the browser is run with `--enable-logging --log-file=file`,

children will now be run with `--enable-logging=handle --log-file=N`.

It is not possible to mix stderr logging with file logging (it will

still work for the browser process), but this already does not work

in official builds as std handles are not passed into children.



This also allows the CHROME_LOG_FILE to be useful again for renderer

processes if Chrome is run using:



$env:CHROME_LOG_FILE="d:\temp\env-log.log"

chrome.exe --enable-logging



the browser will inspect the env var and provide a handle to that

file when starting renderer processes.



Running the browser with --enable-logging=handle directly is not

supported, these flags should only be provided by the browser when

starting child processes.



Tests: Manually tested results https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Hq37YReGM91fmcCcqkRbjtjwP62FVH_zpZtfpSPlLeY/edit?usp=sharing

Bug: 328285906, 40270808

Change-Id: Id79731b2d35ab3ee58f6c1612990bdec1485da68

entry.title: [remoting] Fix thread-checker issue with SelectSource().
entry.content:
This recent CL:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5367338

introduced an extra call to DesktopCapturer::SelectSource() before the

capturer was started on a dedicated thread.



DesktopCapturerProxy and DesktopCapturerWrapper both verify that all

methods run on the same thread. An exception is CreateCapturer()

which is allowed to run on any thread (following the typical pattern

of initializing objects on one thread, then using them on another

thread). The extra SelectSource() call caused the thread-checker to be

bound to the wrong thread.



This CL fixes the issue by folding the ID into CreateCapturer(), so

the caller does not need to separately call SelectSource() to

initialize the capturer.



SelectSource() is still checked by the thread-checker (since it's

used for single-stream mode). Once everything is multi-stream,

SelectSource() can be completely removed from interfaces and classes

in src/remoting - it would remain only in webrtc::DesktopCapturer.



Fixed: 329361264

Change-Id: Ia6fd360cf2edae19b0de54e3f8de4900ad0a522b

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366570

Commit-Queue: Lambros Lambrou

entry.title: [Gamepad] Remove std::unique_ptr<T[]> from HidWriterWin
entry.content:
This CL replaces occurrences of std::unique_ptr with std::wstring.

Using std::unique_ptr does not automatically preserve the size of

the allocation. This forces a need for ad-hoc bounds checks, leading to

bugs which attackers use to compromise our users.



This CL also contain a small follow-up fix to CL 5368671 in raw_gamepad_device_win.cc



Bug: 326458686, 40285824

Change-Id: Ie5884836dd018e362a08e89541046f26c313aef9

entry.title: webnn: Enable the XNNPACK delegate in the TFLite backend
entry.content:
The code to enable the XNNPACK delegate when the right build flags are

set was accidentally removed in the final version of r1266242.



This change restores that code and refactors the buildflag header target

so that the state of the build_tflite_with_xnnpack flag defined in

//third_party/tflite/features.gni is available in a buildflag header

without depending on //components/optimization_guide.

entry.title: Add HandleInvokeInternal on HTMLDialogElement
entry.content:
This adds support for the experimental `invoketarget` behavior for

HTMLDialogElement.



See explainer section here:

https://open-ui.org/components/invokers.explainer/#defaults.



This introduces new behavior for HTMLDialogElements such that:



- If an `invoketarget` points to a `` (and the parent logic

fell through):

- If the `invokeaction` is `` (empty - the auto state) try to toggle the dialog as modal.

- If the `invokeaction` is `close`, try to close the dialog

- If the `invokeaction` is `showModal`, try to show the dialog as

modal.



Bug: 1494810

Change-Id: I701e0e33780ba7787096201d02a50cd071febf4d

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Implement and Override OnBandwidthChanged() callback
entry.content:
Context: go/cros-nearby-presence-np-nc-interop



This CL implements `OnBandwidthChanged()` for NearbyConnectionsManager.

When a connection is requested, the `ConnectionListenerV3` callback

sends `BandwidthInfo` containing the connection medium and quality. This

behaves effectively the same as the v1 `OnBandwidthChanged()` but takes

a PresenceDevice instead of just an endpoint ID.



Additionally updates `NearbyConnectionsTest.DisconnectFromDeviceV3` to

use a more thorough disconnection function from `ClientProxy`.



A follow-up CL will have NearbyConnectionsManager maintain

`PresenceDevice` references so we aren't passing back a near-empty

`PresenceDevice` to clients. (see: b/328296135)



Test: unit tests added

Fixed: b/321729671

entry.title: webnn: Enable TFLite-based WebNN service on Android and ChromeOS
entry.content:
This change expands the usage of the TFLite-based WebNN service

implementation from Linux-only to Android and ChromeOS as well.



Enabling it on Android is a necessary step for issue 41486052, which

will leverage Android-specific TFLite delegates to access mobile ML

accelerator hardware. As expected since this is the first change to

enable a functional end-to-end implementation of WebNN there is a small

binary size impact. About half of this is the Mojo bindings and the

other is the graph validation and TFLite flatbuffer construction code.

This is largely unavoidable. The bulk of the binary size cost has

already been borne by the other Chrome features which originally

introduced the TFLite dependency.



Enabling it on ChromeOS is a necessary step for issue 326356909 however

as currently implemented the instance of TFLite in the browser process

will be used instead of deferring to the ChromeOS ML service. This can

be handled in a follow-up CL.



This change maintains the existing arbitrary rule that setting the

deviceType to "gpu" means the WebNN service will be used instead of

either the XNNPACK backend (or Model Loader on ChromeOS).



Bug: 326356909,41486052

Binary-Size: See commit description.

Change-Id: Ief27b1f8ec58de78d859596b89015225a5ab993c

entry.title: Implement custom bitset class for UKM web feature tracking
entry.content:
Part 1/?



Does not use std::bitset<>/base::EnumSet because they do not provide

the flexibility needed for efficient serializiation/deserialization

of the bitset.



Data is stored from "right to left" -- i.e., element 0 maps to the

rightmost bit of the bitset.



Design doc: http://shortn/_oLL7f6mDts



This CL only adds the bitset implementation. The UKM recorder does not

yet make use of it. That will be done in a follow up CL.

entry.title: [Text Contrast] Plumb values into Skia
entry.content:
This is the final change to enable contrast and gamma values from the

registry to get plumbed into Skia. This is not currently enabled

for web_tests - instead command line values are used to verify

that the text contrast has changed. A follow-up will enable registry

values for web_tests.



Values for contrast and gamma are stored on FontRenderParams, and

plumbed into Skia via LegacyDisplayGlobals. Tests were added for

rendering via a new VirtualTestSuite, and since this goes through

a different path than the browser, additional tests were added for

plumbing FontRenderParams values.



Two new command line flags are added here, for setting contrast

and gamma respectively. These are used in the virtual test suite

but also apply to the browser.

entry.title: Apply standard parsing of pseudo-elements for web animations
entry.content:
Note that for web-animations, using no-colons or single-colon already

works as specified, and the difference here is in making the argument

parser more forgiving (as per spec).



This is behind a flag, together with full parsing for getComputedStyle.

See I2S: https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/p-7KuUD_p20/m/fe8Iwb-IAAAJ



The following test already asserts the behavior with single/no colon, which doesn't change with this CL:



TEST=external/wpt/web-animations/interfaces/Animatable/animate.html



The newly added test (third_party/blink/web_tests/external/wpt/css/css-view-transitions/web-animations-api-parse-pseudo-argument.html) asserts

the new observable behavior, which only applies to pseudos with

arguments.

entry.title: [Android TRM] Fix suggestions lag issue for "old nothing" case.
entry.content:
The Tab Resumption Module uses synced Foreign Session data. The delay

from *requesting* to *reading* fresh data led to the "suggestion lag"

issue, where following Foreign device tab update, on a Local device we'd

need to open NTP twice for TRM to update.



Background: When TRM starts, it has two ways to fetch suggestion data:

* "Fast path" to get stale data quickly.

* "Slow path" to get fresh data slowly (request followed by callback),

which may never return if "fast path" data is already fresh.



Both paths are needed: Only using "fast path" would lead to consistent

lag; only using "slow path" can lead to an indefinite wait. Imposing a

timeout can work, but this is not a robust solution. Also, periodically

requesting fresh data would be too expensive.



crrev.com/c/5317863 attempts to fix the lag issue by using "fast path"

results first, then let (optional) "slow path" results trigger TRM

update, upon which the old output is overwritten using output from fresh

data (up to some stability time bound).



Unfortunately, this only fixes the most egregious case where "fast path"

already yields suggestions. If "fast path" yields nothing -- this can

happen because:

* At start up, global sync may finish too late, and fetching Foreign

Session data yields nothing.

* There was legitimately no suggestion, but suppose that suggestions

become available through Foreign device activity (with ample time

for propagation).

-- then ModuleDelegate.onDataFetchFailed() is called as the TRM hides.

Meanwhile, if "slow path" yields fresh suggestions, then Magic Stack

would already have removed the TRM; thus suggestions won't be shown in

the current page, and this leads to the lag issue again.



This CL solves the lag issue by realizing that onDataFetchFailed() is

not essential: If onDataReady() is never called, Magic Stack would

eventually timeout on TRM and keep it hidden.



Omitting onDataFetchFailed() when "fast path" ("Initial call" from the

loadModule()'s perspective) yields nothing (and keeping the Mediator in

the INIT state) would be an extremely simple fix. However, if

"slow path" ("Update call") also yields nothing, then

onDataFetchFailed() should still be called so that the Magic Stack won't

have to wait for timeout, and can show other modules earlier.



Our solution is to introduce the TENTATIVE_GONE state to the Mediator

(in addition to {INIT, SHOWN, GONE}). This state is reached when

"fast path" yields nothing. This allows "slow path" to be detected,

whence onDataFetchFailed() can if it yields nothing.



Also add 4 tests to TabResumptionModuleMediatorUnitTest, to handle the

"fast path" and "slow path" yielding {nothing, something} in various

combinations.



Bug: 329122611, 327300173, 1515325

Change-Id: I66cd07115d993940a953d29535c404d5050d4789

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5366274

Reviewed-by: Xinyi Ji

entry.title: Stop recording Scheduling.ThreadController.*.Any.* in microseconds
entry.content:
When running content_unittests test AttributionInteropTest I noticed

errors in output, reading like this:



```

Histogram Scheduling.ThreadController.ActiveIntervalDuration.Any.Other

has mismatched construction arguments

```



This was caused by first calling UmaHistogramTimes() and then

UmaHistogramCustomMicrosecondsTimes() with the same histogram name. I

think the reason is that LogIntervalMetric() calls attempt to record a

zero delta, which seems to be coming from lazy_now. Another reason for

zero deltas could be time mocking in the test.



The GetSuffixForHistogram() uses this particular delta to choose the

time suffix "Any". It should rather be "Short" when recording with

UmaHistogramCustomMicrosecondsTimes().



The fix is to use another suffix formatter function for the

UmaHistogramTimes() catch-all recording.



Bug: 328282277

Change-Id: Iab416c93df012b664e25ae5e6aa4dc0cc159b733

entry.title: Show items from birch model in birch bar
entry.content:
Updates BirchBarView to request birch data fetch when it gets shown,

and populates it with top birch items from birch model in response

to the birch data fetch.

Changes BirchChipButton builder interface to take a BirchItem instead

of individual burch item properties (setting a `BirchItem` will

initialize birch chip from the birch item properties).



Small cleanup in `BirchItem` interface - instead a struct with its

properties publicly exposed, changes `BirchItem` to a class (which

is more appropriate at this time), and exposes `BirchItem` properties

using getter functions. It adds getters for item subtitles, and optional

"secondary" action used to indicate the chip button needs an add-on

button. Adds `ActivateSecondaryAction()` virtual method to be called

when the button associated when the secondary action gets clicked. The

secondary action is currently used to add "Join" add-on button to

calendar chip.



BUG=b/305094143

entry.title: Rename auto_enrollment_client_impl_unittest classes
entry.content:
AutoEnrollmentClientImplTest -> AutoEnrollmentClientImpleFRETest

PsmHelperInitialEnrollmentTest ->

AutoEnrollmentClientImplInitialEnrollmentTest



AutoEnrollmentClientImpl and this corresponding test class basically

run in two modes, FRE or initial enrollment. Let's standardize these

names to reflect that (at the cost of making them more verbose).



Additionally, with Flex Auto Enrollment, Initial Enrollment != PSM,

so this makes it more logical for FAE to share the same initial

enrollment test class.

entry.title: [AriaNotify] Support multiple AriaNotification enum attributes
entry.content:
Deprecating `IntAttribute` for the `ariaNotify` interrupt and priority

properties in favor of a `IntListAttribute` for both, which will allow

multiple notifications to be serialized into `AXNodeData`.



After this change, `SerializeAriaNotificationAttributes` still overrides

a single notification within `AXNodeData`. A later patch will correctly

plumb the notifications through these attribute lists.

entry.title: [canvas] Use synthetic timer when hidden on mac
entry.content:
When a tab is hidden, the BeginFrameSource is disconnected. This

causes offscreen canvas to quit drawing. This CL switches to a

synthetic timer so that some progress is made.



Note that other platforms don't do this, and it's not clear

why. However, the behavior on mac makes quite a lot of sense;

one would use `kHiddenButPainting` if one wanted to produce

frames on a regular cadance.



Anyway, making a change in canvas seemed like a safer thing to

to do vs changing how viz's frame sources work -- that could have

follow-on consequences for a lot more cases than canvas.



Change-Id: Id4a8e3c68a7dedaa66004a4d30aade33e4a2e138

entry.title: Add missing messages to the HostControlDispatcher handler
entry.content:
While working on the host I occasionally see "Unknown control

message received" in the log file. I would like to know which

control message was received but it's not simple since the

ControlMessage contains a dozen or so optional fields and does

not use oneof.



I've added some logging statements to the if tree for the current

set of ControlMessages. The unhandled messages will log out which

message they are or 'unknown' in case we add a new message to the

proto w/o adding it to the HostControlDispatcher.

entry.title: cros: Install notification limit
entry.content:
Notifications are unbounded, users can have as many as their machine

can store. We have an OOM issue with chromebooks which is a bit hard

to root-cause.



There are reports of some users having 118MB of notifications

(and in some extremes, up to 1GB) stored. Install a limit on the client

to prevent this.



It's possible the users are getting sent a large amount by unruly

extensions, it's also possible they are getting sent massive

images repeatedly. This basic limit of 75 notifications should prevent

most of these OOMs. This will be rolled out via finch to see if we have

a reduction in OOMs across crOS.



Bug: b:315373019

Change-Id: I8149d8aaff9d1e47b66a1b91ddf8f23b43b89274

entry.title: [Interop] Add TestDriver support for get_computed_label and get_computed_role
entry.content:
Implement the TestDriver APIs get_computed_label and get_computed_role

as specified at [1] and [2].



These are needed for the accname tests in the Interop2024 Accessibility

focus area [3].



These APIs were added to WPT in [4] and are already supported in

WebDriver. Implementing them on window.internals allows us to run

these tests in the normal Chromium test environment, which will help

us in getting the tests passing for Interop2024.



[1] https://w3c.github.io/webdriver/#get-computed-label

[2] https://w3c.github.io/webdriver/#get-computed-role

[3] https://wpt.fyi/results/accname?label=master&label=experimental&aligned&view=interop&q=label%3Ainterop-2024-accessibility

entry.content:

entry.title: Add support for auto keyword in CSS calc-size().
entry.content:
This adds support for the auto keyword in calc-size() by adding the

small changes needed through the whole pipeline: parsing, storage, and

layout. The layout change here is only a single change to activate the

changes in the dependent CLs.



This adds a number of tests for auto. The existing tests for animation

from a neutral keyframe to calc-size(auto, size) do not yet work, but

animation between calc-size(auto, ...) values works (as shown by the new

tests).



Bug: 313072

Change-Id: Ibe0c1597eef0bf442f58375da70ea5a12b620acd

Reviewed-by: Ian Kilpatrick

entry.title: Push resolution of auto into ResolveBlockLengthInternal.
entry.content:
This pushes the resolution of 'auto' values into other values into

ResolveBlockLengthInternal. This is needed to support auto values

inside of calc-size().

entry.title: Move static part of upload preparation.
entry.content:
Part of the upload requests that never change are moved to the client,

so that they don't need to be kept together with each cached upload.

With that, we can cache the events and perform upload to the server

at a later time, if necessary.



Tested manually on VM and with

`git cl try -B luci.chrome.try -b win-celab-try-rel`



Bug: b:327243582
